V68.study_title_en: International Social Survey Programme: Family and Changing Gender Roles I - ISSP 1988
V68.study_title_de: International Social Survey Programme: Family and Changing Gender Roles I - ISSP 1988
V68.notes_en: AT DE: (If not married) Do you have a steady life-partner?

V69.study_title_en: International Social Survey Programme: Family and Changing Gender Roles I - ISSP 1988
V69.study_title_de: International Social Survey Programme: Family and Changing Gender Roles I - ISSP 1988
V69.notes_en:
Education I: Years in school

GB-GBN: Years in school: Recode from - How old were you when you have completed continuous full-time education?
US: What is the highest grade in elementary school or high school that you finished and got credit for?
AT: How many years in school incl. years at university, but without vocational training after compulsory school do you have?
HU: Years in school
NL: Exact years of education since 4th birthday
IT: How many years in general have you studied? (Consider from years at primary school to university grades)
IE: Total years in full-time education started at 5 years

V70.study_title_en: International Social Survey Programme: Family and Changing Gender Roles I - ISSP 1988
V70.study_title_de: International Social Survey Programme: Family and Changing Gender Roles I - ISSP 1988
V70.notes_en:
Education II (categories)

DE: What kind of complete general school-education and (if code 5 or 6) university qualification do you have?
GB-GBN: (If more than first qualification) Highest educational qualifications obtained
US: What is the highest degree?
AT: What kind of highest school qualification do you have?
HU: Completed school grades
NL: Educational level last followed
IT: Degree of study
IE: Educational level

V71.study_title_en: International Social Survey Programme: Family and Changing Gender Roles I - ISSP 1988
V71.study_title_de: International Social Survey Programme: Family and Changing Gender Roles I - ISSP 1988
V71.notes_en: Respondent: Current employment status - specified version

V72.study_title_en: International Social Survey Programme: Family and Changing Gender Roles I - ISSP 1988
V72.study_title_de: International Social Survey Programme: Family and Changing Gender Roles I - ISSP 1988
V72.notes_en:
Hours worked weekly

DE: How many hours per week do you normally work in your main job, including overtime?
GB-GBN: (If in paid work, employee and self-employed) How many hours a week do you normally work in your main job?
AT: How many hours per week do you work normally in your main job or have you worked in your last main job (incl. overtime)?
US: How many hours did you work last week, how many hours do you usually work a week?
NL: (If R actually has a job: all who are employed and all who are not in labour force, but have a job with less than 15 hours per week) Number of hours paid work per week
IT: Working hours per week
IE: Hours per week in present or last job

V73.study_title_en: International Social Survey Programme: Family and Changing Gender Roles I - ISSP 1988
V73.study_title_de: International Social Survey Programme: Family and Changing Gender Roles I - ISSP 1988
V73.notes_en:
Note:
See Note No. 1 (Click on 'Metadata' in the tree on the left, scroll the content frame on the right down to 'Variable Notes', then open the linked PDF document.)
Respondent's Occupation

DE GB-GBN IE US: Present (main) job or last (main) job

V81.notes_en:
Unemployment I

DE: (If R has a full-time occupation at present) Have you ever been unemployed in the last ten years?
GB-GBN: (If in paid work and more than 10 hours working as employee) During the last 5 years - that is since 1984 - have you been unemployed?
AT: Have you ever have been unemployed in the last 10 years?
US: In any time during the last ten years, have you been unemployed and looking for work for as long as one month?

V82.study_title_en: International Social Survey Programme: Family and Changing Gender Roles I - ISSP 1988
V82.study_title_de: International Social Survey Programme: Family and Changing Gender Roles I - ISSP 1988
V82.notes_en:
Unemployment II

GB-GBN: (If unemployed in last 5 years) How many month in total during the last 5 years?
AT: (If R unemployed in last 10 years) How long have you been unemployed? (If more than once, all periods together)

V84.study_title_de: International Social Survey Programme: Family and Changing Gender Roles I - ISSP 1988
V84.notes_en:
Political party affiliation/ party identification

US: Generally speaking, do you usually think of yourself as a Republican, Democrat, Independant or what? (If Republican or Democrat) Would you call yourself a strong or not a very strong Republican or Democrat? (If Independent..) Do you think of yourself as closer the Republican or Democratic party? (The recode considers both the party affiliation and the subjective intensity of that party affiliation.)
AT: Which political party do you most agree with?

V87.study_title_de: International Social Survey Programme: Family and Changing Gender Roles I - ISSP 1988
V87.notes_en:
Vote next election II - which party?

DE: If there were Federal-elections next sunday, which party would you vote for with your second vote?
GB-GBN: Generally speaking, do you think of yourself as a supporter of any one political party? If yes: Which one? Do you think of yourself as a little closer to one political party than the others? If yes: Which one? If there were a general election tomorrow which political party do you think you would be most likely to support?
NL: If elections were held now, which party would you vote? The party codes are not available, only the recoded version. (See V86)

Religion

GB-GBN: Do you regard yourself as belonging to any particular religion? If yes, which?

HU: In which religion was R baptised or registered?
NL: Do you regard yourself as belonging to a church community? If yes, which one?
IE IT: Religion

US: How often do you attend religious services?
AT: How often do you attend divine service?
NL: How often do you go to church lately (or in the last half year)?
IE: Attend worship

GB-GBN: Most people see themselves as belonging to a particularclass. Please tell me which social class you would say you belong to?
US: If you were asked to use one of four names for your social class, which would you say you belong in: the lower, the working, the middle, or the upper class?
NL: To which social group do you attribute yourself: to the working class, lower middle class, upper middle class or upper class?
